game_description: Layers of Fear VR is a psychedelic horror game that pulls you into the depths of insanity. Now its constantly changing Victorian mansion can be explored without limits thanks to the all-in-one Virtual Reality experience of Oculus Quest. Delve deep into the mind of an insane painter and discover the secret of his madness. Uncover the visions, fears and horrors that entwine the painter and finish the masterpiece he has strived so long to create. Redesigned with Quest in mind for greater interactivity and immersion, Layers of Fear VR is a first-person horror game built on a rich, dark story. Explore an environment overflowing with macabre artwork and unravel secrets through twisted puzzles. Take control of a painter seeking to create his magnum opus… before losing his mind in the process. The psychological horror of Layers of Fear will leave you questioning your own eyes and mind. Dare you help paint a true Masterpiece of Fear? Put on your Quest and discover what awaits…
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil), Russian, Spanish (Spain), Turkish
review_1: The description is exactly as advertised. You have to find clues. It's a slow start, but once you really start picking up those clues, rooms change, doors change, hidden doors are discovered, and the jump scares really start popping, even causing some screams in our household!! We love this game and have not regretted purchasing it. I was iffy on purchasing because of other reviews, but I personally think it's worth having if you like a good mystery with a scare.
review_2: Overall I like this game. I let the negative reviews keep me from it for a while, but when it went on sale I decided to finally try it. If you enjoy haunted house walkthroughs but with more interaction (e.g. picking up clues, solving the occasional puzzle) i think you will enjoy this game. It does drag on for a bit but you keep encountering new situations and learn more about the story so that was fine with me. There are a couple glitches. A few times it was really difficult to open a door which was frustrating and twice i was somewhat stuck in the floor, but when i physically took a step or 2 the game resumed as normal. The decor seems like a copy paste job with encountering the same paintings and drawer contents room after room so i found that a bit disappointing. There are a lot of jump scares. Don’t forget to look up and behind you as things change a lot and you get to see some interesting things. The telephone part was probably my favorite part and the bathroom scene was cool.

review_5: I'm an old player of Layers of Fear, and I find that the Layers of Fear on Quest is very exciting. However, when I started the game, I noticed that some of the models' UVs are strange and the static lighting seems broken. Therefore, I hope that INCUVO can fix these issues to enhance the gaming experience.
